cscd211Methods

Class Lab3Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd211Methods.Lab3Methods

  • public class Lab3Methods
extends java.lang.Object
    The methods class for the Lab 3 methods that you must write
    This contains a set of methods that will be required for the game play

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Lab3Methods()
      You WILL NOT WRITE this constructor it is provided by Java.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Card[] createCards()
      The createCards method creates an array of Cards Since the method is not passed a parameter a standard deck of playing cards is created.
      static Card[] createCards(int total, int suitsPer, int... cardValues)
      The createCards method creates an array of Cards Since the method the method is passed a total for the total cards in the deck, a suitsPer to represent how many of each suit are in the deck.
      static Player[] createPlayers(int totalPlayers, int totalCards, java.util.Scanner kb)
      The createPlayers method prompts the player for their name and creates a Player object and places it into an array of type Player
      static boolean goAgain(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The goAgain method prompts the user to play again the method ensures the user enters yes or no (any case) This method also ensures the carriage return is stripped from the input buffer

      NOTE: A precondition that is not possible to enforce here is the input buffer is empty when the method is called.
      static void printDeck(Deck deck, java.io.PrintStream fout, java.lang.String message)
      The printDeck method creates prints the cards in the deck one card per line to the appropriate stream
      static int readCardsToDeal(java.util.Scanner kb, int maxPlayerCards)
      The readCardsToDeal method prompts the user for the number of cards to deal to each player.
      static int readMaxPlayerCards(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The readMaxPlayerCards method creates prompts the user for the number of the maximum number of cards the player can have in their hand.
      static int readTimesToShuffle(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The readTimesToShuffle method creates prompts the user for the number of times to shuffle and ensures the value is greater than 0
      static int readTotalPlayers(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The readTotalPlayers method prompts the total number of players that will be playing the game.

    • Method Detail

      • goAgain

        public static boolean goAgain(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The goAgain method prompts the user to play again the method ensures the user enters yes or no (any case) This method also ensures the carriage return is stripped from the input buffer

        NOTE: A precondition that is not possible to enforce here is the input buffer is empty when the method is called.
        Parameters:
        kb - representing the Scanner object
        Returns:
        boolean - Representing if the user wants to play again
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • createPlayers

        public static Player[] createPlayers(int totalPlayers,
                                     int totalCards,
                                     java.util.Scanner kb)
        The createPlayers method prompts the player for their name and creates a Player object and places it into an array of type Player
        Parameters:
        totalPlayers - Representing the total number of players for the game
        totalCards - Representing the total cards a player will have in their hand
        kb - Representing the Scanner object
        Returns:
        Player [] - Representing the array of the Players playing the game
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if totalPlayers or totalCards less than 1;

      • readTotalPlayers

        public static int readTotalPlayers(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readTotalPlayers method prompts the total number of players that will be playing the game. The method ensures that the number is greater than 1 (2 or more players);
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object
        Returns:
        int - Representing the total Players playing the game
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • createCards

        public static Card[] createCards()
        The createCards method creates an array of Cards Since the method is not passed a parameter a standard deck of playing cards is created. The cards start at the ace of clubs and end with the king of spades. The order is clubs, diamonds, hearts, spades.
        Returns:
        Card [] - Representing the filled array

      • createCards

        public static Card[] createCards(int total,
                                 int suitsPer,
                                 int... cardValues)
        The createCards method creates an array of Cards Since the method the method is passed a total for the total cards in the deck, a suitsPer to represent how many of each suit are in the deck. An variable arguments that represent the values of the cards in the deck.
        Parameters:
        total - Representing the total cards in the deck
        suitsPer - Representing the number of each suit for the deck - 2 would mean 2 sets of clubs 2 sets of diamonds, 2 sets of hearts and 2 sets of spades
        cardValues - Representing a variable sized array of ints for the values for the cards in the deck
        Returns:
        Card [] - Representing the filled array of cards
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if total, suitsPer is less than or equal to 0
        if the variable arguments is null

      • printDeck

        public static void printDeck(Deck deck,
                             java.io.PrintStream fout,
                             java.lang.String message)
        The printDeck method creates prints the cards in the deck one card per line to the appropriate stream
        Parameters:
        deck - Representing the total deck of cards
        fout - Representing the PrintStream to where to print
        message - Representing a message to be printed before each card is printed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Deck, PrintStream, or String variable argument is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if message is empty

      • readTimesToShuffle

        public static int readTimesToShuffle(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readTimesToShuffle method creates prompts the user for the number of times to shuffle and ensures the value is greater than 0
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to read the number from the keyboard
        Returns:
        int - Representing the number of times to shuffle the deck
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner variable argument is null

      • readMaxPlayerCards

        public static int readMaxPlayerCards(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readMaxPlayerCards method creates prompts the user for the number of the maximum number of cards the player can have in their hand. Minimum number is 1
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to read the number from the keyboard
        Returns:
        int - Representing the maximum number of cards in the players hand
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner variable argument is null

      • readCardsToDeal

        public static int readCardsToDeal(java.util.Scanner kb,
                                  int maxPlayerCards)
        The readCardsToDeal method prompts the user for the number of cards to deal to each player.
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        maxPlayerCards - Representing the maximum number of cards the player can hold
        Returns:
        int - Representing a value that is between 1 and the maximum number of cards the player can hold
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null or maxPlayer cards is less than 1
